edu.sjsu.cs.ghost151

Enum Game

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.lang.Enum<Game>
      • edu.sjsu.cs.ghost151.Game
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable, java.lang.Comparable<Game>

    public enum Game
extends java.lang.Enum<Game>
    Game will:
    • Configure the board
    • Configure ghosts
    • Configure the target
    • Update the game
    • Render the game
    • Run the number of ghosts
    • Print statistics at conclusion of game
    Author:
    Alben Cheung, MD Ashfaqul Islam, Shaun Guth, Jerry Phul

        for (Game c : Game.values())
    System.out.println(c);

      • valueOf

        public static Game valueOf(java.lang.String name)
        Returns the enum constant of this type with the specified name. The string must match exactly an identifier used to declare an enum constant in this type. (Extraneous whitespace characters are not permitted.)
        Parameters:
        name - the name of the enum constant to be returned.

      • ConfigureBoard

        public void ConfigureBoard(int numberOfGhosts,
                  java.util.Random generator)
        ConfigureBoard will configure the number of defined or user entered ghosts and place them on the Board object.

      • Run

        public void Run(int numberOfGhosts)
        Run takes the number of Ghost objects to create and configures the board for simulation. At conclusion of simulation, the print statistics method will be called to display the results.
        Parameters:
        numberOfGhosts - number of Ghost objects to start the game with.

      • Update

        public void Update()
        Update will request from each Ghost object if the target (PacMan) has been acquired. If so, set isRunning to false so the Game loop may end.

      • Render

        public void Render()
        Render takes the board object, converts it to a string so that it may be printed on standard out.

      • GetStatistics

        public java.lang.String GetStatistics()
        GetStatistics returns a string representing the final game statistics.
        Returns:
        the string to print for statistics

      • IncrementCommunicationsCount

        public void IncrementCommunicationsCount()
        IncrementCommunicationsCount takes statistics on the number of Communications completed by all Ghost objects.

      • IncrementMovementCount

        public void IncrementMovementCount()
        IncrementMovementCount takes statistics on the number of movements completed by all Ghost objects.

      • getNumberOfCommunications

        public int getNumberOfCommunications()
        getNumberOfCommunications the number of communications completed by all Ghost objects.
        Returns:
        total number of communications.

      • getNumberOfMovements

        public int getNumberOfMovements()
        getNumberOfMovements the number of movements completed by all Ghost objects.
        Returns:
        total number of movements.

      • getNumberOfGameLoops

        public int getNumberOfGameLoops()
        getNumberOfGameLoops the number of game loops completed
        Returns:
        total number of game loops

      • getGhosts

        public Ghost[] getGhosts()
        getGhosts return the Ghost object.
        Returns:
        the Ghost
